intro: Melpomene pennellii, commonly known as the red hibiscus, is a species of flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is characterized by its vibrant red flowers, which are typically five-petaled and showy, attracting pollinators such as bees and hummingbirds. The plant belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes other hibiscus species and cotton. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are woody and often branched. Melpomene pennellii thrives in tropical climates and requires well-drained soil and full sunlight for optimal growth.
